title: Daily Market-Mover Brief

top5.headline: US–Iran nuclear talks rumors (Geneva)
top5.mechanism: Reports of talks drove Brent/WTI down >2% on risk-premium unwind. Unconfirmed rumors can rapidly reprice oil's embedded hedge against Middle East supply disruptions.

market_impact.description: Lower oil → reduced inflation expectations → easier central bank policy path → weaker commodity-exporter currencies

top5.watch_next: Official State Dept/Iran confirmation or denial (24–72h); Israel reaction/signaling; oil rebound if talks denied

sources.summary: Reports of renewed nuclear talks driving oil lower; no official joint statement found

top5.headline: Russia strikes Ukraine energy grid
top5.mechanism: Large combined strike (Feb 16–17 overnight) degrades EU-adjacent power infrastructure. Risk of spillover into European gas markets if damage disrupts cross-border flows or forces increased consumption.

market_impact.description: Infrastructure damage → potential EU gas volatility → higher energy costs (inflation) → prolonged tight ECB policy

top5.watch_next: European gas volatility/spillover (24–72h); EU sanctions response; cold-weather forecasts tightening supply-demand

sources.summary: Large combined strike package verified overnight; continued infrastructure targeting

top5.headline: BOJ April hike signal + strong JGB auction
top5.mechanism: Strong 5Y JGB auction demand; former board member signals April (vs March) hike. Delayed hike keeps yen weaker longer, sustaining global carry trade profitability. Rapid hike would trigger carry unwind and global vol.

market_impact.description: BOJ timing → yen strength/weakness → global carry trade dynamics → risk asset volatility (equities, EM currencies)

top5.watch_next: USDJPY reaction to yield spread compression (24–72h); BOJ Governor Ueda comments; move above 145 signals carry stress

sources.summary: Strong demand for 5-year sector; yields lower, supporting JPY stability

top5.headline: Hawkish Fed repricing
top5.mechanism: Markets pricing only ~50bp cuts for 2026; USD supported by 'higher for longer' narrative. Sustained rate advantage keeps dollar bid, tightening financial conditions abroad.

market_impact.description: Higher-for-longer Fed → USD interest-rate advantage → stronger dollar → weaker non-USD currencies, tighter conditions abroad

top5.watch_next: FOMC Minutes (24–72h); retail sales data; Fed speaker contradictions of hawkish consensus

sources.summary: Markets pricing ~50bp Fed cuts in 2026; hawkish hold supports USD

top5.headline: China post-LNY return
top5.mechanism: Onshore markets reopening; traders assessing holiday consumption data. PBoC fixing and reverse repo ops signal liquidity/FX management stance. Offshore CNH stable during holiday suggests limited capital-flight pressure.

market_impact.description: PBoC yuan management → regional currency stability → EM sentiment → risk asset flows

top5.watch_next: PBoC fixing and reverse repo ops (24–72h); onshore-offshore CNY gap; weak consumption data from holiday

sources.summary: Onshore markets reopening Feb 18; offshore CNH stable/stronger during holiday

markets_snapshot.rates: USD: Hawkish hold, ~50bp cuts priced for 2026; focus on FOMC minutes. JPY: Yields lower after strong JGB auction; April hike more likely than March.
markets_snapshot.fx: USD supported by higher-for-longer Fed. JPY defensive on BOJ April timing. CNY: onshore reopens; watch PBoC fixing/reverse repos for FX management signals.
markets_snapshot.equities: Supported by lower oil (disinflationary) but capped by Fed hawkishness and geopolitical risk (Russia-Ukraine energy, Iran uncertainty).
markets_snapshot.credit: Spreads stable; lower oil is net positive (easier conditions) but watch for widening if energy vol spikes or risk-off catalysts emerge.
markets_snapshot.energy: Brent ~$68 (down >2% on Iran deal rumors); Russia-Ukraine strikes keep floor under prices despite risk-premium unwind on diplomacy hopes.

geopolitics_watch.chokepoints: Red Sea rerouting persists (status quo); no new major kinetic event in Hormuz. Russia-Ukraine energy strikes are key near-term risk for EU gas.
geopolitics_watch.sanctions: US-Iran diplomacy (unconfirmed): potential thaw could lead to sanctions enforcement relaxation discussions (market pricing probability > 0).
geopolitics_watch.escalation_risk: Iran deal rumors are key headline driver for oil (24–72h); Israel reaction could shift Middle East risk premium quickly. Russia energy strikes risk EU spillover.

next_catalysts: US State Department / Iran MFA statements on Geneva talks (official confirmation or denial)
FOMC minutes (language on inflation outlook, rate path, dissent)
European gas prices (volatility tied to Russia-Ukraine energy strikes)
BOJ communications (clarity on March vs April hike timing from Gov Ueda)
PBoC fixing and reverse repo ops (China liquidity/yuan management signals)
Israel response to Iran deal rumors (Middle East risk premium)

methodology.evidence_standards: Confirmed = primary sources (central banks, official data, govt statements, verified military reports); Reported = secondary coverage or unverified reports.
methodology.continuity_tracking: Each Top-5 declares New/Ongoing/Reversal vs prior brief.
methodology.promotion_rule: Geopolitics promoted only if market channel active within 1–3 sessions.
